question: Who held the view that Ideology gives legitimacy to the rule of the dominant class?
explanation: According to the Marxist theory, an Ideology is a set of ideas, beliefs and arguments which are precisely used to lend legitimacy to the rule of the dominant class as they are the one who owns the means of production. Ideology projects and promotes a value system under which even the exploitation of the dependent class who does not owns the means of production seems to be justified.
